Its fun, and overall a great game with great story

Overview:
Portal 2 is a puzzle game where you use portals to get through test chambers. The concept is simple, but this is made interesting by other game objects such as launch pads, which can launch you up in the air, gel, which can make you bounce or add velocity, light bridges, which can be used to get to hard to reach places, and turrets, which can kill you.
Summary:
Buy this game if you like good puzzles, which require you to think creatively to solve, want a cheap game with low requirements or want to try a classic game. You could buy it at full price, but unless you're super impatient, it would be better to wait for discounts, as the game goes on sale often. It's well worth the sale price

Story:
The story follows the main character who woke up in an unknown location, in which she has to do tests for eternity. She has to defeat GLADOS, to escape. The story was well executed, and although the game is a puzzle game, towards the end, there is high amount of tension. The ending was also great.
Gameplay:
The puzzles are well executed. Out of the whole game, the solutions were beautiful. There wasn't a solution that annoyed me, because it was stupid or undiscoverable. They can make you surprised and think, "it seems so obvious now". The multiplayer is also lots of fun, because it requires some level of team work, and you can think with your partner to find the solution. Overall, the gameplay was excellent.
Controls and graphics:
Controls feel a bit clunky, but it's still acceptable. Graphics are okay, considering this game is almost 10 years old, but acceptable.
Value and replay value:
For the original price, I'd say it's worth it, but on sale it's of great value. I got about 10 hours on the singleplayer. And the multiplayer gives even more content. Although, you need someone to play it with. If none of your friends want the game, post a post looking for someone to play with on the portal 2 discussion page. The only thing is that it's short, but considering how much it costs, that isn't really an issue.
Overall:
9.5/10
